extendedIngredients.name: rainbow trout
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ozs domestic caviar such as osetra or rainbow trout
extendedIngredients.originalName: domestic caviar such as osetra or rainbow trout

extendedIngredients.name: sour cream
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 cup sour cream (preferably at room temperature)

title: Beggars' Purses
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Beggars' Purses a try. One serving contains 185 calories, 7g of protein, and 14g of fat. This recipe serves 8 and costs 63 cents per serving. This recipe from Epicurious has 1 fans. If you have salt, flour, milk, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 hours. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 23%. This score is not so awesome. Try Chocolate and Raspberry Beggars Purses /GIVEAWAY, Chicken Biriyani Beggars Pouches, and Vegetable Purses for similar recipes.
instructions: PreparationMake crpe batter:                                        Melt butter in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat and set aside 2 tablespoons for cooking crpes. Continue to cook butter remaining in skillet until it has a nutty fragrance and is golden brown, about 2 minutes. Blend brown butter with remaining crpeingredients, except chives, in a blender until smooth. Add chives and pulse 1 or 2 times to just combine. Let batter stand 30 minutes.                                                                            Blend brown butter with remaining crpe ingredients, except chives, in a blender until smooth. Add chives and pulse 1 or 2 times to just combine. Let batter stand 30 minutes.                                    Blanch whole chives:                                        Blanch chives in a small saucepan of boiling water 10 seconds. Drain and plunge into an ice bath. Pat dry.                                    Make crpes:                                        Lightly brush skillet with butter, then heat over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Stir batter. With skillet off heat, add a scant 1/4 cup batter, tilting and rotating skillet to coat bottom. (If batter sets too fast, reduce heat slightly.) Cook until golden around edges, 15 to 30 seconds. Loosen with a heatproof plastic spatula, then flip crpe over with your fingertips. Cook until underside is set, about 30 seconds. Slide onto a plate. Make more crpes, brushing skillet with butter and stacking crpes on plate.                                    Assemble purses:                                        Top each crpe, browned side up, with about 1 1/2 tablespoons sour cream and 2 teaspoon caviar. Gather crpe around filling and tie 1 or 2 blanched chives in a knot to close purse. Trim ends of chives if necessary.                                    Cooks' note:Crpe can be made and chives blanched 1 day ahead and chilled. Bring to room temperature before assembling.

steps.step: Melt butter in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat and set aside 2 tablespoons for cooking crpes. Continue to cook butter remaining in skillet until it has a nutty fragrance and is golden brown, about 2 minutes. Blend brown butter with remaining crpeingredients, except chives, in a blender until smooth.
Add chives and pulse 1 or 2 times to just combine.
Blend brown butter with remaining crpe ingredients, except chives, in a blender until smooth.
Add chives and pulse 1 or 2 times to just combine.
Blanch chives in a small saucepan of boiling water 10 seconds.
Drain and plunge into an ice bath. Pat dry.

Lightly brush skillet with butter, then heat over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Stir batter. With skillet off heat, add a scant 1/4 cup batter, tilting and rotating skillet to coat bottom. (If batter sets too fast, reduce heat slightly.) Cook until golden around edges, 15 to 30 seconds. Loosen with a heatproof plastic spatula, then flip crpe over with your fingertips. Cook until underside is set, about 30 seconds. Slide onto a plate. Make more crpes, brushing skillet with butter and stacking crpes on plate.

Top each crpe, browned side up, with about 1 1/2 tablespoons sour cream and 2 teaspoon caviar. Gather crpe around filling and tie 1 or 2 blanched chives in a knot to close purse. Trim ends of chives if necessary.
Cooks' note:Crpe can be made and chives blanched 1 day ahead and chilled. Bring to room temperature before assembling.
